item.title: Tensorflow - Your CPU supports instructions that this binary was not compiled to use
item.description:
If you've installed TensorFlow from pip, you've probably come across this message:

tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:141] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX2 FMA

Well, I did too and it got me wondering how much of a difference those instructions end up making. People often say GPUs are required for any non-trivial ML work so I wanted to see if that was really true. I decided to delve in and optimize TensorFlow and make it faster on my machine. I gave a talk about this yesterday, the slides will be attached at the end as well.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zaman

item.title: FOSSASIA 2018 - SELinux Policy Development
item.description: A month ago was FOSSASIA 2018 and I got to give another talk about SELinux. Last years talk was only about the basics of how things SELinux works and labels and allow rules. This year covered more of the policy side of things. I went over now to write a Reference Policy module and did a quick demo.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zaman

item.title: FOSSASIA 2017 - SELinux Introduction talk
item.description: FOSSASIA 2017 was this weekend and I gave an introductory talk on SELinux. The event details are here. There were a lot of great talks over the three days. Engineers.sg filmed all the talks too so you can see them all on the FOSSASIA youtube channel.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zaman

item.title: GDG-SG DevFest 2016 - Android: Under the Hood
item.description: GDG-SG had its annual DevFest on Saturday. I gave a talk on a quick overview of the internals of Android.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zaman

item.dc:creator: Jason Zaman

item.title: Trusted Boot Part 1
item.description: I finally managed to get tboot working in a way that makes sense to me. For those unfamiliar, tboot uses Intel's Trusted eXecution Technology to invoke a dynamic root of trust and then measure all the components you boot with (eg kernel and initrd). What took me ages to figure out was how one can upgrade kernels while keeping this chain working.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zaman

item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello World. I've been meaning to start a blog for a while but never got around to it. Russell Coker posted on the SELinux mailing list yesterday asking about Planet SELinux so I figured now is as good a time as any for starting one.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zaman
